meanings.definition: To remove a stopper or closure from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unstoppers the bottle to pour the liquid out.
meanings.sent2: He always unstoppers the pen before writing.
meanings.sent3: The magician unstoppers the hat to reveal a rabbit inside!
meanings.sent4: The key unstoppers the lock, releasing the treasure within.
meanings.sent5: With a twist, she unstoppers the flask, releasing a pleasant aroma.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that removes a stopper or closure.
meanings.sent1: The unstoppers in the factory work efficiently to open all the bottles.
meanings.sent2: She asked the unstoppers to help open the stubborn jar.
meanings.sent3: The little robot acted as the unstoppers, opening all the doors in the house.
meanings.sent4: The unstoppers at the event made sure all the drinks were ready for the guests.
meanings.sent5: The unstoppers in the kitchen were always in demand during busy cooking sessions.
